qas.question: What does it mean to read the word LORD in all capitals in the Bible?

answers.text: signifies that the word represents the tetragrammaton

qas.question: What is the tetragrammaton gor God?
No matter which religion, what is usually used as the name for the Supreme Being?
What form of the word God refers to polytheistic gods?
What is the name of God in Judaism?
What does the all caps word LORD used in some bibles represent?

plausible_answers.text: a distinction between monotheistic "God" and "gods" in polytheism

qas.question: In Edom what does the capitalized form of God represent?
How is the Midianite word for God normally used?
Related to the Midianite deity, what does the word remain in Edom?
What proper name is God given in Midian?
What does the word El signify in English?

context: In the English language, <a0_0>the capitalized form of God<a0_0/> continues to represent <b8_0>a distinction between monotheistic "God" and "<a5_0>gods<a5_0/>" in <a1_0>polytheism<b8_0/><a1_0/>. The English word <a4_0>God<a4_0/> and its counterparts in other languages are normally used <b9_0>for any and all conceptions<b9_0/> and, in spite of significant differences between religions, the term remains an English <b10_0>translation common to all<b10_0/>. The same holds for Hebrew El, but in Judaism, God is also given a proper name, the tetragrammaton <a3_0><a6_0><a7_0><b11_0>YHWH<b11_0/><a7_0/><a6_0/><a3_0/>, in origin possibly the name of an Edomite or Midianite deity, Yahweh. In many translations of the Bible, when the word LORD is in all capitals, it <a2_0>signifies that the word represents <b12_0>the tetragrammaton<b12_0/><a2_0/>.
